info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 07 at 3:21PM PST until December 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT... -For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, and winds gusting as high as 40 mph, that can cause reduced visability due to blowing snow. -For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 25 inches possible, with wind gusts as high as 45 mph, which could cause reduced visability due to blowing snow. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County, including all areas along I-5 and highway 89, as well as Mt. Shasta City, Dunsmuir, and McCloud. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Winter Storm Warning, 1"/hr snowfall rates are likely at 80% probability. This period is concentrated in the 1 PM to 6 PM timeframe. Heavy snow rates are also expected Friday night during the Winter Storm Watch. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
